roleset.name: to expose to harm or danger, having potential to harm

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Bush even disclosed privately that one Reagan-era deal with Congress required him to notify the odious Panamanian dictator , Manuel Noriega , if the U.S. learned of a coup plot that [*T*] might endanger his life .

example.name: Adjectival rel: endangered
example.text: Once the Syrian regime is toppled . Iran will face a direct threat , and 30 % of the Chinese crude oil imports will be severely endangered . It is bound to affect the domestic economy .
example.arg: 30 % of the Chinese crude oil imports

example.name: both args
example.text: Paying attention to just a palatable level of politics is dangerous to everyone's liberty.
example.arg: Paying attention to just a palatable level of politics

roleset.note: ENDANGER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'endanger' based on WSJ; adjectival 'endangered' based on BOLT-6. (from endanger.01-v)
DANGEROUS-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, endanger.01. (from dangerous.01-j)
ENDANGERED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from endangered.01-j)
